title: How to Make a Littlest Pet Shop Building

steps.headline: Get lots of small boxes.
steps.description: Glue the small boxes together in a row or stacked, depending on how much room you have to store and display the building. Alternatively, use one large box. Take off the lid and get some large rectangle cardboard pieces from another box, and stick them inside to make different floors of the mall. Secure with glue, tape or staples.

steps.headline: Turn the mall on its side so it stands up.
Add various signs such as 'Abercrombie' or 'EB Games'.
Make doors.
Add typical items.
steps.description: For example, draw an outline of or make an elevator, escalator and soda machine.

steps.headline: Use a slightly smaller cardboard box.
Put signs hanging from the ceiling that say things like, 'pets', 'sporting goods and outdoors', 'juniors', etc.
Arrange objects that align with the signs in an area below the sign.
steps.description: You can get a lot of ceramic and plastic inanimate objects at hobby or craft stores that carry doll house items. Check online as well, such as auction sites but get your parent's okay to purchase things online. Alternatively, make things from items you have around the house.

steps.headline: Add some general items.
steps.description: For example, make soda machine and a cool crane (toy game). Glue to the outside of the store for a special effect.

steps.headline: Make a bed.
Add your doll house furniture and accessories.
steps.description: Stores sell lots of housewares, so this makes doll house items ideal. Mix up playsets. You can mix up any miniature toys you own to create store stock.

steps.headline: Add floor coverings.
steps.description:
These can be made from all sorts of things, for example:
Go to a carpet or curtain store and ask for sample offcuts. Tell them what it's for and they'll often be willing to help. Cut up old, unwanted clothes. Ask your parents for the rag bag. Crochet or knit small rugs. Or use your patchwork skills to make a carpet or rug. Cut up pictures of flooring materials and glue in place.

steps.headline: Glue the boxes together.
steps.description: They can go up or sit side-by-side.

steps.headline: Decorate the boxes.
Make some accessories for the house.

text:
Making a Mall Get lots of small boxes. Glue the small boxes together in a row or stacked, depending on how much room you have to store and display the building. Alternatively, use one large box. Take off the lid and get some large rectangle cardboard pieces from another box, and stick them inside to make different floors of the mall. Secure with glue, tape or staples. Turn the mall on its side so it stands up. Add various signs such as 'Abercrombie' or 'EB Games'. Make doors. Draw a door outline on one part of the box or several doors on different boxes. A double door is best for stores. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/37/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/37/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut out the inner part of the doors. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cover with plastic to make them appear like glass doors. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} For an external exit door, simply cut a rectangle on one side of the box and write EXIT over the top of it. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add typical items. For example, draw an outline of or make an elevator, escalator and soda machine. Making a Store Use a slightly smaller cardboard box. Put signs hanging from the ceiling that say things like, 'pets', 'sporting goods and outdoors', 'juniors', etc. Arrange objects that align with the signs in an area below the sign. You can get a lot of ceramic and plastic inanimate objects at hobby or craft stores that carry doll house items. Check online as well, such as auction sites but get your parent's okay to purchase things online. Alternatively, make things from items you have around the house. Add some general items. For example, make soda machine and a cool crane (toy game). Glue to the outside of the store for a special effect. Making Objects for the Stores Make a bed. Cut a large square for the base. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut a short rectangle that has the same length as the base and glue or tape it on the side. This will be the headboard. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut a rectangle with a width of about 2 inches/5cm and the same length of the headboard.This will go on top of the headboard, and if you like, make this wider, to be just above the end of the base. Get a piece of cardboard that reaches down to the end of the base and glue or tape it on to make a canopy. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Get some very short pieces of cardboard. Put them in the front and sides except for directly under the area on top of the headboard. For that part, get 2 little rectangles that reach from the area on top of the headboard to the base. You're done! {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} To really customize it, get an old tee or a shirt and cut out bedspread and pillows. To make pillows fluffy, get a rectangle of fabric, size of choice and get some cotton balls and arrange however you want. Now, fold it in half and staple or sew closed. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet5.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/db/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet5.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-10Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add your doll house furniture and accessories. Stores sell lots of housewares, so this makes doll house items ideal. Mix up playsets. You can mix up any miniature toys you own to create store stock. Add floor coverings. These can be made from all sorts of things, for example: Go to a carpet or curtain store and ask for sample offcuts. Tell them what it's for and they'll often be willing to help. Cut up old, unwanted clothes. Ask your parents for the rag bag. Crochet or knit small rugs. Or use your patchwork skills to make a carpet or rug. Cut up pictures of flooring materials and glue in place. Making an LPS House Choose decently sized cardboard boxes. Glue the boxes together. They can go up or sit side-by-side. Decorate the boxes. Paint or paper-cover the boxes to make them seem more homely. Cut out some windows on the outside of the house. Add curtains made from pieces of scrap fabric. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut out a door that goes between the rooms of the house. If you made the house upwards, add a staircase made from a concertina piece of card. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} If you can find paper with brickwork or wood on it, use this to cover the outside of the boxes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Glue fake flowers to the sides of the house, to represent a garden. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-15Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make some accessories for the house. This will make the LPS house a home for the LPS pets. Here are just a few simple ideas: Shelf: Use a square piece of cardboard and fold a tiny tab at the top. Glue the tab to the wall. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Bed: Use a rectangular piece of cardboard on top of a rectangular piece of foam or Styrofoam. Cover with scrap fabric to make a mattress. Add scrap fabric sheets and duvet, plus a pillow or two. Pillows can be made by wrapping fabric around cotton balls and gluing in place. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Computer: Fold a small piece of paper over a small wooden block or a square of thick cardboard. Cover with white paper. Draw a screen on the top. Make a rectangular piece of cardboard for the keyboard. Cover in white paper, then draw little keys onto it. For fun, use a small Lego or similar mouse as the computer "mouse". {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Rugs: Cut out rug images from magazines or print-outs; use scraps of fabric; use carpet offcuts, etc. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Littlest-Pet-Shop-Building-Step-16Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}
